verbs.example: Would you mind opening the window?
Do you fancy going out tonight?
I can't imagine living without music.
The job involves traveling a lot.
I couldn't resist eating the chocolate.
I don't recall seeing him there.
She resented having to work late.
I won't tolerate being treated badly.
How can you justify spending so much?
verbs.negative: How can you justify to spend ✗

verbs.example: I dread going to the dentist.

phrases.example: I can't help laughing when I see him.
phrases.meaning: unable to stop yourself from doing something

phrases.example: I can't stand waiting in queues.
I gave up smoking last year.
Keep on trying and you'll succeed.
It's no use crying over spilt milk.
She's busy preparing for the exam.
I spend hours reading every day.
I don't feel like going out tonight.
It's no good complaining about the weather.
phrases.meaning: there's no point, it won't help

phrases.example: There's no point in arguing with him.
I have trouble sleeping at night.
I can't bear watching horror movies.

prepositions.example: I'm interested in learning Japanese.
She's good at solving problems.
I'm tired of waiting for him.
I look forward to seeing you.
Instead of complaining, do something.
I'm fond of reading detective novels.
He's keen on playing football.
She succeeded in passing the exam.
He insisted on paying the bill.
She apologized for being late.
I'm afraid of losing my job.
He was accused of stealing.
She's capable of doing better.
Who's responsible for making dinner?
Italy is famous for making great wine.
I'm sorry for shouting at you.
I'm worried about failing the exam.
She's excited about traveling abroad.
Are you serious about learning French?
I'm not used to getting up early.
He's accustomed to working alone.
I object to being treated like a child.
Nothing can prevent me from succeeding.
Smoking is prohibited from entering.

go_activities.title: GO + Gerund (Activities)
examples: go swimming
go shopping
go fishing
go skiing
go dancing
go running
go hiking
go cycling
go jogging
go sailing

verbs.example: She decided to move to London.
We're planning to buy a house.
I hope to see you soon.
I promise to call you tomorrow.
He refused to answer the question.
I managed to finish on time.
I can't afford to buy a car.
They agreed to meet at noon.
He failed to pass the exam.
He claims to be an expert.
I guarantee to finish on time.
I struggled to open the jar.
He threatened to call the police.
I swear to tell the truth.
He demanded to see the manager.
I intend to finish by Friday.

adjectives.example: This exercise is difficult to understand.
It's hard to believe the news.
It's important to eat healthy food.
It's necessary to book in advance.
It's nice to see you again.
I was surprised to hear the news.
She's eager to start the project.
Don't be afraid to ask questions.

purpose.example: I came here to study English.
She works hard in order to succeed.
I left early so as to avoid traffic.

gerund.example: I stopped smoking. (I don't smoke anymore)

infinitive.example: I stopped to smoke. (I paused my activity to have a cigarette)

gerund.example: I remember meeting him. (I have a memory of when we met)

infinitive.example: Remember to meet him at 5pm. (Don't forget this future action)

gerund.meaning: unable to recall a past action
gerund.example: I'll never forget visiting Paris. (I have a lasting memory)

infinitive.example: I forgot to visit my grandmother. (I didn't do it)

gerund.example: Try adding more salt. (Test this approach)

infinitive.example: I tried to open the door. (I attempted but maybe failed)

gerund.meaning: feel sorry about a past action
gerund.example: I regret telling him the secret. (I'm sorry I did it)

infinitive.example: I regret to inform you that you failed. (Formal announcement)

gerund.example: She went on talking for hours. (Continued talking)

infinitive.example: After school, he went on to study medicine. (Next stage of life)

gerund.example: This job means traveling a lot. (It involves traveling)

infinitive.example: I meant to call you yesterday. (I intended to but didn't)

examples: My parents made me study hard.
The teacher made us repeat the exercise.
patterns.note: Causative: someone forces another to do something

examples: My parents let me go to the party.
The teacher let us leave early.
patterns.note: Permission: someone allows another to do something

examples: I'd rather stay home than go out.
Would you rather walk or take the bus?
You'd better study for the exam.
We'd better leave now or we'll be late.

patterns.gerund_example: I saw him crossing the street. (Action in progress)
patterns.infinitive_example: I saw him cross the street. (Complete action)
patterns.note: Perception verbs: gerund = ongoing, infinitive = completed

examples: The car needs washing. (= needs to be washed)
Your hair wants cutting. (= needs to be cut)
This room requires cleaning. (= needs to be cleaned)
patterns.note: Gerund has passive meaning after these verbs

examples: I don't mind his/him coming late.
She appreciated my/me helping her.

transformations.sentence1: I really enjoy reading science fiction novels.
She finished the project and submitted it on time.
transformations.sentence2: She was _____ the project on time.

transformations.sentence1: Try not to make the same mistake again.
transformations.sentence2: Try to _____ the same mistake again.

transformations.sentence1: I'm thinking about moving to another city.
Would it be OK if I opened the window?
Why don't we leave a bit earlier than planned?
transformations.sentence2: I _____ a bit earlier than planned.

transformations.sentence1: You should definitely try the chocolate cake.
She plays the piano every single day.
I really miss my life in London.
He said he didn't take the money.
I don't like getting up early in winter.
Do you want to go to the cinema tonight?
transformations.sentence2: Do you _____ to the cinema tonight?

transformations.sentence1: I can't think what life would be like without music.
The project requires a lot of international travel.
If you drive too fast, you might lose your license.
transformations.sentence2: Don't _____ your license by driving fast.

transformations.sentence1: We put off making the final decision.
I couldn't stop myself from buying the dress.
I don't remember seeing him at the party.
transformations.sentence2: I don't _____ him at the party.

transformations.sentence1: She hates having to work on weekends.
I can't put up with being lied to.
I'd like to learn French next year.
It's necessary for you to study harder.
She made the decision to move to London.
We have intentions of buying a house next year.
I expect that I'll see you at the party.
I anticipate arriving around 8pm.
I give you my word that I'll call tomorrow.
He said he wouldn't answer the question.
She said she would help me with the project.
I succeeded in finishing the work on time.
It looks like he's very happy.
It looks as though she understands the problem.
I often forget people's names.
He says he's an expert in computers.
I selected medicine as my university subject.
You've earned the right to win this competition.
We're getting ready to leave for the airport.
He acted as if he was sleeping.
Don't be afraid to ask for help.
I had great difficulty opening the jar.
Swimming in the ocean is something I enjoy.
Dancing is her passion.
Waiting in queues is something I dislike intensely.
I'd choose walking over driving.
The rain began falling at 3pm.
She commenced singing at a young age.
Despite the interruption, he carried on working.
I can't tolerate being lied to.
I quit smoking five years ago.
I paused my work to have a cigarette.
transformations.sentence2: I stopped my work _____ a cigarette.

transformations.sentence1: I have a clear memory of our first meeting.
transformations.sentence2: I _____ you for the first time.

transformations.sentence1: Don't forget you have to meet him at 5pm.
My visit to Paris will always stay in my memory.
I didn't remember to visit my grandmother.
As an experiment, add some more salt to the dish.
transformations.sentence2: _____ some more salt to the dish.

transformations.sentence1: I made an effort to open the door but it was locked.
transformations.sentence2: I _____ the door but it was locked.

transformations.sentence1: I'm sorry that I told him the secret.
I'm sorry to say that you didn't pass the exam.
transformations.sentence2: I _____ inform you that you failed.

transformations.sentence1: She continued speaking for another hour.
After university, he became a doctor.
This position involves a lot of travel.
I intended to phone you yesterday but forgot.
My parents forced me to study medicine.
My parents allowed me to travel alone.
I'd prefer to stay home instead of going out.
It would be wise to leave now.
I observed him while he was crossing the street.
I watched the entire action of him opening the door.
Someone should wash this car.
I don't object to his late arrival.

sentences.text: I really enjoy _____ (read) detective novels in my free time.
She finished _____ (write) her dissertation last month.
Try to avoid _____ (make) the same mistakes again.
I'm considering _____ (move) to another city for work.
Would you mind _____ (close) the window? It's quite cold.
I suggest _____ (leave) a bit earlier to avoid traffic.
The doctor recommended _____ (take) vitamins daily.
She practices _____ (play) the violin for two hours every day.
I really miss _____ (live) by the beach.
He denied _____ (steal) the money from the office.
I dislike _____ (get) up early in winter.
Do you fancy _____ (go) to the cinema tonight?
I can't imagine _____ (live) in such a cold climate.
This project involves _____ (work) with international teams.
You risk _____ (lose) everything if you're not careful.
They delayed _____ (announce) the results until today.
I couldn't resist _____ (buy) those shoes on sale.
I don't recall _____ (meet) him before.
She resents _____ (have) to work on weekends.
I won't tolerate _____ (be) spoken to like that.
I can't help _____ (laugh) when I watch comedy shows.
I can't stand _____ (wait) in long queues at the supermarket.
I gave up _____ (try) to fix my old computer.
Keep on _____ (practice) and you'll get better.
It's no use _____ (complain) about the weather.
The museum is definitely worth _____ (visit).
She's busy _____ (prepare) for her final exams.
I have difficulty _____ (understand) his strong accent.
I don't feel like _____ (go) out tonight.
There's no point in _____ (argue) with him.
I'm very interested in _____ (learn) about different cultures.
She's really good at _____ (solve) complex mathematical problems.
I'm tired of _____ (listen) to your excuses.
I'm looking forward to _____ (see) you at the party.
I'm afraid of _____ (lose) my job in the recession.
She's worried about _____ (fail) the exam.
Are you serious about _____ (study) medicine?
I'm not used to _____ (work) night shifts.
She apologized for _____ (arrive) so late.
He insisted on _____ (pay) for everyone's dinner.
I want _____ (travel) around the world someday.
You need _____ (study) harder if you want to pass.
She decided _____ (accept) the job offer in London.
We're planning _____ (visit) Japan next spring.
I hope _____ (hear) from you soon.
I expect _____ (finish) the project by Friday.
I promise _____ (call) you as soon as I arrive.
He refused _____ (answer) any more questions.
She offered _____ (help) me with my homework.
I managed _____ (complete) all the work before the deadline.
He appears _____ (be) very happy with the results.
She seems _____ (understand) the problem now.
I tend _____ (forget) people's names easily.
He claims _____ (be) an expert in artificial intelligence.
I chose _____ (study) medicine because I want to help people.
You deserve _____ (win) after all your hard work.
We're preparing _____ (leave) for the airport.
He pretended _____ (be) asleep when I came in.
Don't hesitate _____ (ask) if you need any help.
I struggled _____ (open) the tightly sealed jar.
This math problem is difficult _____ (solve).
English grammar is easy _____ (learn) with practice.
It's hard _____ (believe) what happened yesterday.
It's impossible _____ (finish) all this work in one day.
It's important _____ (arrive) on time for the interview.
I'm happy _____ (help) you with your project.
She's willing _____ (work) overtime this week.
They're eager _____ (start) the new project.
Don't be afraid _____ (make) mistakes when learning.
He was reluctant _____ (leave) his comfortable job.
I like _____ (swim) in the ocean during summer.
She loves _____ (dance) to Latin music.
I hate _____ (wait) in long queues.
I prefer _____ (walk) to driving when possible.
It started _____ (rain) heavily around 3pm.
She began _____ (learn) piano at age five.
He continued _____ (work) despite feeling tired.
I can't bear _____ (see) animals suffer.
I stopped _____ (smoke) five years ago. [quit permanently]
I stopped _____ (buy) milk on my way home. [paused to do it]
I remember _____ (meet) him at the conference last year. [past memory]
Remember _____ (lock) the door when you leave. [don't forget]
I'll never forget _____ (visit) the Taj Mahal. [lasting memory]
I forgot _____ (call) my mother yesterday. [didn't do it]
She stopped _____ (work) at that company last month. [quit]
We stopped _____ (have) lunch at a nice restaurant. [paused]
Try _____ (add) more salt if it tastes bland. [experiment]
I tried _____ (open) the door but it was locked. [attempted]
I regret _____ (tell) him the secret. [sorry about past]
I regret _____ (inform) you that you failed. [formal announcement]
She went on _____ (talk) for another hour. [continued]
After school, he went on _____ (study) medicine. [next stage]
This job means _____ (travel) abroad frequently. [involves]
I meant _____ (phone) you yesterday. [intended to]
My parents made me _____ (study) medicine. [forced]
My parents let me _____ (go) to the party. [allowed]
I'd rather _____ (stay) home tonight. [preference]
You'd better _____ (hurry) or you'll be late. [advice]
I saw him _____ (cross) the street. [action in progress]
The car needs _____ (wash). [passive meaning]
I enjoy _____ (read) science fiction in my spare time.
She decided _____ (accept) the job offer.
He loves _____ (play) football on weekends.
I stopped _____ (drink) coffee after 6pm. [quit habit]
This book is easy _____ (read) and understand.
I'm interested in _____ (learn) new languages.
She promised _____ (call) me tomorrow morning.
I can't stand _____ (wait) in traffic jams.
Remember _____ (buy) milk on your way home. [don't forget]
My teacher made me _____ (rewrite) the entire essay. [forced]
